description: From Middle English pelerin, from Old French pelerin, from Latin peregrīnus (“foreigner, traveler”). Doublet of pilgrim.

examples: Can e're thy bountyes be by vs repayed? / All-vertuouse princes! Africk's gloriows starre! / We straying Pelerins will ne'r assay't, / Thy great deserts exceed owr pow'r so farre.
